All of them should not have any points inside or inside their edges. Therefore, they should have areas equal to $\dfrac{1}{2}$. From the fact that the areas of these triangles are proportional to barycentric coordinates, it follows that the coordinates of the internal point are equal to the average of the three vertices of the triangle.
